Description: PROVIDE A RIGOROUS, RESIDENTIAL, SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATH (STEM), AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION FOCUSED MULTI-DAY PROGRAM THAT UTILIZES AN ENVIRONMENTAL STEM CURRICULUM. THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO INSPIRE AND TRAIN HIGH SCHOOL AND COLLEGE STUDENTS ON KEY SCIENCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, INCLUDING THE AIR, WATER AND/OR SUPERFUND PROGRAMS. TYPICALLY, THOSE SELECTED WOULD BE SENIORS IN HIGH SCHOOL AND FRESHMEN AND SOPHOMORES IN COLLEGE.SSUES, INCLUDING AIR, WATER, AND/OR SUPERFUND PROGRAMS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM IS THE NATIONAL HISPANIC ENVIRONMENT COUNCIL.

THIS PROJECT WILL EE360+ IS A CONSORTIUM OF 27 ORGANIZATIONS WORKING TO ENHANCE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE AND INCREASE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS. EE360+ PROVIDES TOOLS AND INFORMATION FOR EDUCATORS AND THE PUBLIC TO BUILD KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS THAT LEAD TO A MORE ENGAGED CITIZENRY. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATOR TRAINING, BUILDING A TRANSFORMATIONAL LEADERSHIP TRAINERS BUREAU; INCREASING THE REACH AND IMPACT OF EEPRO, AND IMPLEMENTING A COMMUNITY CHANGE FELLOWSHIP. THE 5-YEAR PARTNERSHIP WILL TRAIN 4 MILLION EDUCATORS AND REACH APPROXIMATELY 1.5 MILLION ADULTS AND YOUTH.
PROJECT EE306 WILL TRAIN A CADRE OF CULTURALLY DIVERSE EDUCATION PROFESSIONALS TO DELIVER ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION (EE) IN FORMAL AND NON-FORMAL SETTI
